{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents describe the role of antigen-presenting cells (APCs) in providing co-stimulatory signals for T-cell activation. The formation of peptide-MHC complexes is one aspect of APC function. Macrophages and Langerhans cells are mentioned as types of APCs, but M-cells are not mentioned. Thymocytes are immature T-cells that do not play a role in antigen presentation.", "answer_choice": "D"}
